reviews.review_msg: If you ever see this man as a professor for a class, please take it. I have only had him once and this breaks my heart. Honestly never had so much fun in a course. He made school fun

A caring and enthusiastic prof! While the criteria for projects like the creative project were vague (no rubric or anything), you will get a high mark if you participate in class and put effort into your work. He is a master at making your ideas seem profound during class discussion- you will never feel awkward for participating in lectures.

Fair marker, not too hard but not too easy either. Lousy incoherent lectures though, only like 2/3 of the class was there every day. Once insisted the Wizard of Oz was a metaphor advocating the 1930's New Deal even though it was written by a Republican in the 1890's. That really annoyed me

He is AWESOME. Seriously, doesn't matter what class you have him for, he's always interested in what he's teaching. I wouldn't say he's too easy of a marker by any means, but he's definitely clear in what he's looking for. Amazing prof for in-class discussion too, never makes anyone feel stupid. Good pop-culture references to engage the class, too.
He's great. He communicates the information and themes effectively. He's kinda nerdy, but in a cute way.

This TA's marking makes no sense and is completely arbitrary. When you ask for help/advice she tells you not to worry about it, that you'll do fine. And then you get a bad mark out of the blue. Is extremely picky on insignificant, mundane stylistic details. Comments in general on essay are unclear and unhelpful.

I WISH I had read your comments before taking the course! i got a C on a paper! I've never had lower than a B+ except ONE time I got a B! I've taken up to 4th year courses in English, and in this second year course, she said my writing was not sophisticated enough!?!? That I have improper paragraph structure?!?! BAH! all of her comments were dumb

Susan is an amazing prof, who lectures with clarity and has very easy-to-follow slides. Always super encouraging of students' interpretations and suggestions. One gets the sense that she fully understands what it is like for a university student to be daunted by having to make insightful literary analysis, but she totally assuages such concerns.

Susan is a great professor. She is professional and a fair marker; I really respect her. Her lectures are well-organized and participation is encouraged. I learned a lot in her class. If you can take a course with her, I would do it!

prof knows her stuff, approachable, definitely see her in office hrs regarding essays, lectures are interesting, really good course books, readings are light, tries to make class enjoyable and succeeds! one of the better english profs at SFU, there are many others to avoid, so dont shy away from this course or prof.

All I learned in this class is that the world is corrupted and confusing. Very useless class. She marks incredibly HARD. Lectures at first seem very interesting, however, topics repeat, and I feel like I've been sitting in one lecture since all the lectures are so similar, therefore, becomes boring. Looking for an easy course? Don't take this one.

I can't imagine that she's been a teacher for very long because she so caught up in her own ideas of things. Didn't allow alternative perspectives on course material. Read directly from overheads without allowing students access to the overheads. Skimmed over much of the course. Worst prof I've ever had - I do not recommend taking a class with her.

Not too bad of a prof, but lecture style of reading primarily off slides made it hard to stay awake early in the morning. Would have liked to go a bit more in depth with things, but left more room to explore my ideas in my writing. TAs were fair. Overall a good class-but make sure you do the readings or really read her notes-final is a bit tricky.
Six books in one semester. Informative and interesting. Made going to school worth it in the early morning.

Alright so basically  she is clear in articulating her argument and adheres to some of the student demands if something is difficult or troublesome.  Fair marker and fair tests, the only problem I found was that she talked a lot about her child and how motherly experience can be hard work but worth it. So, a bit sidetracked but a good prof overall.
Found this prof. very engaging.

Nadine is wonderful... a little off-beat but endearingly so. She is very intelligent and well-spoken. Her lectures are nothing special but she seems to appreciate input from students and attempts to learn names of all the students.  She is down-to-earth and funny.

Dr. Kim was very helpful and accessible. Online classes can be difficult to stay on top of, but she really cares that students complete their work and receive credit. The class was challenging but definitely improved my analysis and writing, which was what I was hoping for when I enrolled.

Burnham makes it extremely clear that he thinks nothing of Undergrads and talks over our heads. He presents concepts that no undergrad in second year will have encountered and does not bother to explain them in the slightest. Would clearly rather not be teaching -- or at least only wishes to teach Graduate students. Luckily he does pick great TAs.

I am continually offput by this professor. He is arrogant and intentionally obscure; he does not seem to care a wit about students' opinions, thoughts, questions. He's basically what you picture when think of a pretentious university professor.

Often goes off on tangents discussing Freud and psychoanalysis, and doesn't relate lecture material to text/course material clearly. The texts for this course were really interesting, but the lectures hardly drew on the texts.
Tough on grading papers!

One of the sweetest, funniest, most interesting profs I've had. His lectures do pretty much consist of him talking about the works, but his thoughts really helped me understand the readings on a deeper level. I had him for the tutorial too and he was nothing but supportive of everyone's ideas. Offers useful feedback too, which I greatly appreciate.

I was disappointed with this prof after reading such great reviews here. He spent a lot of time reading passages from novels, rather than explaining their significance etc. I felt as though more time should have been spent talking about the novels, rather than reading them to the class. Novels were interesting, nonetheless.
Interesting to listen to. Very well read and is clearly passionate about what he teaches. Would definitely take another course with him in the future.

I like Sophie, she's got a good attitude and her lectures are pretty good. Her written assignments were pretty good. However, her final exam was a bit harder than I expected. Some of her book choices weren't to my liking but that's a matter of taste. Overall she's good.

Definately a fun course and prof.  She makes the content interesting and really gets you to think about the material.  Make sure you keep up with the readings as the course moves quite quickly through the material.
Yes, he is hot and also really funny.  I found myself laughing out loud in lectures constantly.
Despite the 8:30 am monday morning lectures, the class was interesting, and a wonderful selection of reading materials.  WOuld definately take another with him
